name: America's Best Value Inn Villa Motel

reviews.text: I was staying with a group of firefighters from Kansas when we got a call from some of our fellow brother firefighters asking if we had any available rooms where we were staying. They complained of getting "smoking" rooms and air conditioning was not working at the hotel they were staying at....Contacted the front desk; they advised they had available rooms and they would make arrangements. Our fellow brothers LEFT the hotel they were out---with no refund---and came to the Villa and enjoyed there stay as well! We had a great time, clean rooms, great service, and hospitality from the Midwest!
reviews.title: Awesome Customer Service!

reviews.text: stayed here for two nights whilst visiting the area very nice motel clean rooms and good location within easy walking distance to town. breakfast basic but ok would recommend
reviews.title: Great location walking distance into town

reviews.text: My 11-year old daughter and I spent one night at the Villa Motel on our way to Pueblo for the Chile Festival. I wanted her to see the cool little town of Manitou Springs and all of the B&Bs were either booked, too expensive, didn't take kids or had a two-night minimum. So we stayed at the Villa Motel. The staff was friendly. We had a ground-floor room with 2 queen beds. It was clean and spacious, but very old-style motel, nothing modern about it (which was fine-it reminded us of our customary NC beach motel except in the mountains). The beds were okay, not great. Shower had good water pressure. So the essentials were met. The walls were thin though, and it was interesting explaining to my daughter what she was hearing from next door at 3 am. There was some road noise, and and footsteps above us. There were a lot of Harley folks staying there that night for some reason, who were up at 6 and hollering at each other in the parking lot. So I guess noise was a factor for us, but that's not the hotel's fault. I would stay here again in a pinch, but request a second-floor room.
reviews.title: One Night at the Villa Motel

reviews.text: This had a suprisingly large room with a king size bed. It was probably the largest room on our trip. The bathroom had the toilet and bath and there was a separate room with hand basin and dressing area.

reviews.text: Everything was very neat and clean and in good condition. The only negative was the narrow stairs that made carrying bags up to the second floor a little difficult.

reviews.text: The free breakfast was quite disappointing, packaged cake muffins, pastries etc but there was some fresh fruit. It wasn't really what I would have considered a breakfast.
reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise and great Value

reviews.text: This was a very clean motel that was very well maintained. It was a great stay for the price and we loved that you could walk very easily to all the shops, restaurants, bars etc in Manitou. We would definitely stay here again! Only downfall is the cleaning lady carts start rolling pretty early (8am) and are really loud so no sleeping in...
reviews.title: Great, quiet place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought it would be neat to stay in one of the cabins with attached carports, so I booked two nights at the rate $79 per night. The cabin we were assigned was the very first one and had no carport which was disappointing. We had to park in front of a tree in the one-way driveway which was kind of a pain to get out of. This is an older hotel but the room was big and clean and had a nice closet area where you can set your luggage. There was no refrigerator or microwave (which was fine with us but some may want that). The bathroom was clean but there was nowhere to put shampoo/soap, etc., while taking a shower except on the edge of the tub. Also, there was no hair dryer. The night we stayed was chilly and the only heat was via a window air conditioner unit and the heat was luke warm at best. The next morning I went to the office and told them the heat was not working properly and that we didn't have a hair dryer. I was told that the cabins don't have hair dryers but there was one I could borrow (which turned out to have been stolen). I asked if we could move to another room and the woman told me that it would cost $94 to move to the "motel" side of the place... but those rooms did have hair dryers. So I went one block down to the Eagle Motel and got a room for $64 that was much better and had awesome heat. The plus of this place is that it is a short walk to historic Manitou Springs downtown and also close to a 24-hour laundry mat which was very helpful. Overall, I would recommend this hotel but just know what you are going to get for your money. I would stay here again but not in the cabins and not for the price they charge. I don't believe it is that great of a value for $79 and I refuse to pay $94 just for the convenience of having a hair dryer!
reviews.title: Not worth the $79 rate

reviews.text: The motels in Manitou Springs are mostly older and worn. This motel is managed by the owners who live on site. They keep it clean and friendly...eventhough it is aged!
reviews.title: SWEET !

reviews.title: Good value, good choice for walkers

reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here two nights. Our 2-bed room on the upper floor was quiet and spacious. We had a microwave and fridge and used our own food to supplement the (very) continental breakfast. (There is a Safeway a couple of miles or so back toward Colorado Springs). Plumbing a little on the slow side, but it worked and there was lots of hot water. Very clean. Not luxury by any means, but comfortable. We most enjoyed the fact that we could walk to our evening meals (Adam's Mountain Cafe --- fabulous!) and that the Garden of the Gods was a very short drive away. We also walked to and from the Pike's Peak Cog Railway ---though it was quite a steep walk of a mile or more. Just so nice to walk and not to have to drive everywhere and squeeze into a parking space. Recommended.
reviews.title: Large room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in one of the cabins, quaint and rustic. We had our own small carport. Close to Manitou Springs shopping - fun place to stroll around. High speed internet requires cable, I had my own but they will loan you one, it works well. Staff suggested the Mason Jar restaurant - they have sample menus at the front desk.
reviews.title: Great Stay, Nice Staff, clean and comfortable, quiet.

reviews.text: We have visited Manitou Springs four times in the last ten years, and each time we've stayed at the Villa and the reasons are always the same-nice clean rooms, fantastic location (can see Pike's Peak from the swimming pool and hot tub!) and great service from the staff. Good value, too, can get a nice big room with a kitchenette for a very reasonable price. And the location can't be beat; within walking distance to downtown Manitou Springs and lots of good shopping and restaurants. We will be back!
reviews.title: Great location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is about 5 minutes walk along paved road into town, across from a park and a drive-in bank. parking free, included breakfast was coffee, tea, sweet pastries, fruit juice (kept in fridge below shelf)and fresh fruit in reception area - take the tray from your room if you need to carry back to room. room was standard 2 double beds, with fridge, coffee maker and microwave in corner (very roomy room) bathroom had basin outside, toilet and bath inside but nowhere to hang anything in the bathrrom. loads of restaurants/gift shops in town, cog railway very steep mile walk away, garden of the gods and manitou dwellings within 10 minutes drive at most. quiet at night
reviews.title: everything you want from a motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a basic motel with the frills of a microwave, fridge and coffee-maker in your room. Our king room on the second floor was plenty big enough for the two of us. The bed and pillows were comfy. The front desk staff was always very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: A good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We particularly liked how the motel is set back from the road. A few motels are right up to the busy road - check google streetview before you book anything in Manitou Springs. We heard no street noise at all from our room. We also liked the easy walk into town, it's a great location. We didn't like the sugar-overdose breakfast and there should be trays provided as you have to carry everything back to your room to eat. But we'd definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Exactly what you want from a motel
